name: Hotel des Mimosas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in a room overlooking the beautiful pool and gardens and with a little balcony to enjoy an evening glass of wine. The staff were all charming and breakfasts (served by the pool/garden) very French and delicious. It was refreshing to be in a family run hotel with so many personal touches and very comfortable lounges should the weather not be perfect. As others have said, the sandy beaches and town are just a short walk and the bus stop to go to Cannes and Nice are at the end of the road. This hotel is a lovely in every way.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect hotel out of the way, great pool & views from the room. Short walk to town, beach & restaurants.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.text: We had to stay in this hotel due the problem with our car. We feel like home as soon as we arrived at the hotel. The staffs were friendly, the hotel was cozy, the room was spacious and the location nearby The famous juan les pins beach.We had breakfast on the terrace on the next day, so relaxed.Even though unexpected things happened during our holidays but we are still enjoying our holidays.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Antibes !

reviews.text: We were booked into 'THE BUNGALOW" a 2 bedroom , 1 bathroom in the grounds of the Hotel
reviews.title: beware the Bungalow!!!

reviews.text: What they dont tell you when offered this accomodation at a reasonable price 150 euros for 4 people per night is that it lacks basic cleanliness and indeed basic decor.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to agree with most of the reviews of this hotel.. The garden and pool are beautiful and the location is good. We had a small problem with the room on arrival and this was quickly sorted by Madame. However, we found the bed rather uncomfortable and the housekeeping staff did not wash used tumblers or replace the disposable ones.
reviews.title: A reasonably priced 3 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast became boring after a few days as there was no variation whatsoever. The odd pain au raisin or brioche would have helped! Light sleepers be aware that the rooms are by no means sound proof and you can be awakened by guests returning late and/or by slamming bedroom doors.
reviews.title: Immaculate hotel

reviews.text: Less than five minutes from the hotel is the bus stop for Antibes. We found this service frequent and reliable, and, at 1€ for three hours, very economical.
reviews.title: Quiet, quaint & Very Well Run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay in a villa when we stay in Juan Les Pins but this time we chose a hotel. Couldn't fault the place at all - immaculately clean, excellent service. They have obviously been doing this for a long time and they are professional hoteliers. Some of the decor is a bit dated but it has a chic feel about it almost like it is so retro it is now back in style.........
reviews.title: Charming, quiet, peaceful and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with my mother on a girls holiday around the Cote D'Azur. Of all the hotels we stayed in this was by far the most memorable for us & if we're in Juan les Pins again we'll definitely stay here. The weather was bad during our stay so we did lots of touring and did not spend much time by the pool but it looked lovely and the gardens are beautiful. The hotel is typically French, it is an old building with generous sized bedrooms and lots of little stools, chairs & presses to add to your comfort. The Madame who owns it is hands-on and wants everybody to enjoy their experience, nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast was perfect, coffee, juice & fresh French bread - we could not want for any more. Overall a very positive experience at Hotel Mimosas.
reviews.title: A lovely place to relax by the pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stumbled across this one through the tourist office. Lovely pool. Rooms were fine. Near to the beach but a bit away from the main drag. Make sure and try the restaurant in the hotel next door, the Alexander, lovely 3 course meal cooked in front of you for €26
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel. Great location and grounds. Nice pool. Very comfortable and well appointed rooms. Super price. An ideal place to escape from the main seaside drag of Juan
reviews.title: An oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two weeks at this gem of a hotel and enjoyed every minute of it! The hotel is in a great location, only a few minutes' walk from the town and beaches, the main road with buses to Antibes and Cannes (one euro), and the railway station for trains to the same and other destinations (Nice, Monaco, Grasse etc). With its lush green gardens full of palm trees and cacti, it's a tranquil oasis away from the hordes. The hotel is well maintained, professionally run and well organised, and offers free wi-fi. The pool area is idyllic and management keep an eye out to ensure it stays that way - for example, if groups of children start shouting and splashing, they'll be asked to keep the noise down so that other guests can relax in peace - very civilised! After the so-called three-star hotels we've stayed in in Paris, our room here was a pleasant surprise: plenty of space, basic but adequate furnishings, a very comfortable bed, and two lovely surprises: a small balcony area which we hadn't expected, with a lovely view over the gardens and pool; and a fridge, which proved invaluable - so nice to have cold drinks on tap! My only complaint was that although overall it was quite clean, there were some parts of the room that had not been cleaned for a long time (don't look under the bed!!). Disposable beakers were never replaced once used; glasses were never washed or replaced; shower gel was only replenished twice in 14 days; and some of the towels were very thin and had definitely seen better days. But all in all, we were very happy and would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a tranquil place to stay.
reviews.title: Charm, character and tranquillity
Charming descreet hide-away with family-type service
reviews.text: Absolutely loved the staff, the place, the service, the swimming pool. Certainly not a place we'd usually go though, as the public there are the relaxing elderly couples and groups of women-friends... If you are a woman, or a couple with kids wanting just a quiet place to relax and enjoy simple pleasures with super-cool service - that's the place to be. The couple who runs the hotel are very professional elderly people with great taste.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned to the UK after having spent the most wonderful few days at Hotel Mimosas,Juan les Pins,France.The lady owner is absolutely charming,her staff are excellent and the accommodation great.I can honestly say it has been many years since my wife and I have enjoyed staying at a hotel so much.It is in a little Oasis in the town of Juan les Pins.I will for sure recommend anyone planning a trip to this area to spend sometime at Hotel Mimosas.
reviews.title: My Mimosas experience

reviews.text: It's hard to know what to write first, because staying here was such a joy. Hotel des Mimosas is an old-style Riviera Hotel set in gorgeous, lush gardens with a beautiful swimming pool, and just a short walk from the beach. While the rooms are not the most modern I've ever stayed in, they are delightfully quirky and spotlessly clean. My room was reasonably large, with soaring ceilings. Even though my room was at the back of the building (and not one of those lovely ones with the terrace at the front), it was bright and cheerful, and filled with a beautiful rosy light in both morning and evening.
reviews.title: Wish I could have stayed all summer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast-, served poolside was lovely, and served by charming and friendly staff. In fact, everyone at Hotel des Mimosas was friendly, welcoming, and very helpful.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a beautiful town

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is definitely on the quiet side (not a place to go for a wild party), but I think that's the way the patrons like it - I understand many are repeat guests. Hotel des Mimosas was the perfect place to relax, recharge, and soak up the beautiful Juan les Pins sun.
reviews.title: Musty bungalow with bugs
An oasis of tranquility
reviews.text: I was solo on this visit, but I think this would also be a very romantic spot to stay! I will definitely be back.

This hotel is quite an oasis in Juan-Les-Pins. It is a 5min walk up the street from the beach, and feels isolated (in a good way). The birds, the foliage, the pool just give it such a unique feel. The grounds are so beautiful. It is fun to wake up to variety of mediterranean birds chirping in the morning.
reviews.title: Old Riviera Charme

description: A charming Hotel in a vast exotic flower garden with palm trees. 5 minutes within walking distance to the sandy beaches and restaurants. 10 minutes by foot to the lively center of Juan-les-Pins. Very calm hotel. Large and beautiful swimming-pool. Private parking free.
